meanings.definition: A ruff or collar worn in the 16th and 17th centuries.
meanings.sent1: In the old paintings, you can see noble ladies wearing a rebato around their necks.
meanings.sent2: The rebato added an elegant touch to the outfit of the historical figures.
meanings.sent3: The tailor mistakenly sewed the rebato onto the sleeve instead of the collar.
meanings.sent4: Her rebato was like a fluffy cloud encircling her neck.
meanings.sent5: The rebato looked like a delicate white wave resting on her shoulders.

meanings.definition: A type of lace or trimming used for clothing.
meanings.sent1: The dress was beautifully embellished with intricate rebato along the hem.
meanings.sent2: She carefully selected the rebato to match the color of her gown.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten played with the loose end of the rebato, unraveling it.
meanings.sent4: The rebato cascaded down the dress like a waterfall of lace.
meanings.sent5: The rebato felt soft against her skin, adding a touch of elegance to her attire.

meanings.definition: To wear or adorn with a rebato.
meanings.sent1: She decided to rebato her dress for the royal ball.
meanings.sent2: He carefully rebatoed his outfit with the finest lace.
meanings.sent3: The fashion designer rebatoed the gown with precision and skill.
meanings.sent4: The actress rebatoed her costume, transforming it into a work of art.
meanings.sent5: They rebatoed the garment, turning it into a masterpiece of elegance.
